headline: US sues Airbnb after host rejected rental to mother with children
summary: The U.S. government sued Airbnb  on Friday, alleging housing discrimination after a host refused to rent an apartment to a mother with three school-age children.  In a complaint filed in San Francisco federal court, the Department of Justice said the home rental company violated the Fair Housing Act through Jarrod Blake's rejection of a rental for Charisse Ylitalo and her sons, aged 9, 11 and 14.  The complaint said Airbnb lets hosts designate property as unsuitable for children aged 2 to 12, or infants under age 2.

The complaint said Airbnb lets hosts designate property as unsuitable for children aged 2 to 12, or infants under age 2.

headline: Airbnb offering housing for people impacted by California fires
summary: As the California wildfires continue to blaze on — projected to cause $150 billion in damages, according to AccuWeather — Airbnb (ABNB) has committed to offer free housing to the victims of the fire, evacuees, and first response workers. Brad Smith reports on the latest news. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

summary: With devastating wildfires continuing to force thousands of people across Los Angeles from their homes, Airbnb.org has committed to providing free, emergency housing for an additional 25,000 people...

headline: Greece bans windowless basements, freezes central Athens licenses in overhaul of short-term rentals
summary: ATHENS, Greece — Lawmakers in Greece began debating proposed legislation on Friday to toughen rules for short-term rentals amid a surge in tourism, including a ban on using converted storage spaces...
